3D Heart Electrophysiology Simulation

Research Assistant
Shanghai, China | Nov 2024 â€“ Jun 2025

  • Built a GPU-accelerated 3D cardiac electrophysiology simulator in C/CUDA, modeling large-scale myocardial grids and parallelizing cell-state updates for high-resolution simulations.
  • Extended a cellular automata framework to explicitly model depolarization and repolarization, redesigning state-transition rules and calibrating timing parameters to better reflect physiological behavior.
  • Analyzed electrical conduction and propagation pathways across atria, ventricles, and the conduction system, examining how activation timing and conduction delays shape characteristic ECG waveforms.
  • Implemented full 12-lead ECG computation and an end-to-end simulation workflow, supporting pacemaker stimulation and arrhythmia scenarios (e.g., PVC, atrial flutter) with visualization for analysis.
